intro: Phlomoides anisochila, commonly known as the variable beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Phlomoides anisochila is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to thrive in various environmental conditions.
